First, we need to calculate the total dose of heparin required. This can be done by multiplying the weight of the patient in kg with the volume of distribution:

Total dose = Weight (kg) x Volume of distribution (mL/kg)
= 50 kg x 60 mL/kg
= 3,000 mL

Next, we need to calculate the loading dose. This can be done by dividing the total dose by the desired peak plasma concentration:

Loading dose = Total dose / Peak plasma concentration
= 3,000 mL / 0.5 units/mL
= 6,000 units
